title: Coronavirus (COVID-19) EMS Resource Page
cleaned_text: Can I Get A COVID Test in Maine?](https://www.maine.gov/covid19/restartingmaine/keepmainehealthy/testing) Maine EMS is working on behalf of the EMS providers and people of Maine by closely monitoring and working with the best available information about the dynamic evolution of the Novel Coronavirus (COVID19). We are working with partners at the Maine CDC, Federal CDC, Governor's Office, and a variety of healthcare experts. We urge Maine people to practice good hand hygiene, wear a face covering, cover coughs and sneezes, and stay home if you are sick. If you are concerned that you have been exposed to COVID-19, call your health care provider, who will determine whether you should be tested and, as appropriate, the next steps. - [CURRENT COVID-19 EMS CLINICAL GUIDELINES](/ems/sites/maine.gov.ems/files/inline-files/2020-06-16%20COVID-19%20Clinical%20Bulletin%20Update.pdf)(PDF) (updated 6/16/2020) - [Emerging Infectious Disease Surveillance (EIDS) Tool Cessation](/ems/sites/maine.gov.ems/files/inline-files/2023-05-09-COVID-19-EIDS-Tool-Guidance.pdf)(PDF) (5/9/23) [Guidance from Maine EMS and US CDC on facemask use regarding those who are fully vaccinated](/ems/sites/maine.gov.ems/files/inline-files/20210311-Ops-Bulletin-RE-US-CDC-Guidance-and-Masking_0.pdf)(PDF) (3/11/21) [Masking During Highly Transmissible Variants](/ems/sites/maine.gov.ems/files/inline-files/2022020702-Clinical-Bulletin-RE-Masking-During-Highly-Transmissible-Variants.pdf)(PDF) EXPOSED EMS CLINICIAN OR DISPATCHER RESOURCES](#) COVID-19 Protocols q - Maine EMS COVID-19 Pandemic Protocol Resources [Clinical Bulletin Updating All Pandemic Protocols Statewide](/ems/sites/maine.gov.ems/files/inline-files/20200728-Updates-to-the-Pandemic-Response-Protocols-Clinical-Bulletin-Final_1.pdf)(PDF) (7/28/2020) - - The bulletin above outlines the current pandemic guidelines and includes the updated protocols. Below are the 3 pandemic protocols (Pandemic response, low risk patients during surge, and cardiac arrest during pandemic) and any supporting resources. The following three protocols are the same as in the overall bulletin listed above. [Pandemic Response Protocol](/ems/sites/maine.gov.ems/files/inline-files/Pandemic-Response-Protocol-20200728.pdf)(PDF) (7/28/2020) - [On Line Medical Control during COVID](https://gcc02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fm.youtube.com%2Fwatch%3Ffeature%3Dyoutu.be%26v%3DxPB_yvHs0_I&data=04%7C01%7Cmarc.a.minkler%40maine.gov%7C420b012fbadf4b8342d508d8979bd613%7C413fa8ab207d4b629bcdea1a8f2f864e%7C0%7C0%7C637426042864433932%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=rgnNyVZOueushpk1wHduTO2fM%2BvxM7ckihdje%2FT8DLE%3D&reserved=0)(for Physicians, PAs, and NPs) (YouTube video) (4/2/2020) - - [Cardiac Arrest Response Protocol During Pandemic](/ems/sites/maine.gov.ems/files/inline-files/Cardiac-Arrest-and-Pandemic-Response-Protocol-20200728.pdf)(PDF) (7/28/2020) - - [Out of Hospital Cardiac Arrest During Pandemic White Paper](/ems/sites/maine.gov.ems/files/inline-files/2020-04-30%20OHCA%20COVID-19%20White%20Paper%20Final_0.pdf)(PDF) (4/30/2020) - - [Notification of Medical Examiner for Out of Hospital Deaths During COVID](/ems/sites/maine.gov.ems/files/inline-files/2020-04-07%20COVID-19%20Notifying%20OCME%20Clinical%20Bulletin_0.pdf)(PDF) (4/7/2020) - [Pandemic Protocol FAQ](/ems/sites/maine.gov.ems/files/inline-files/2020-04-10-Pandemic-Response-FAQ.pdf)(PDF) (4/10/2020) - Note: Phase 1 of the Pandemic Protocol went into effect March 26,2020 and Phase 2 went into effect at 0800 on April 10,2020. Both "Phases" were replaced by the July 28,2020 protocol update. [Guidance for Maine EMS Services applying to perform COVID-19 Swabbing](/ems/sites/maine.gov.ems/files/inline-files/20200825-Guidance-for-EMS-COVID-19-Swabbing-Application-Final.pdf)(PDF) (8/26/2020) [EMS Service Spreadsheet for Documenting EMS Employee Screening (XLS)](/ems/sites/maine.gov.ems/files/inline-files/2020-03-15%20Maine%20EMS%20COVID-19%20Clinician%20Screening%20Tool.xlsx)(updated 3/15/2020) [Model EMS Employee Screening Clarification](/ems/sites/maine.gov.ems/files/inline-files/20211008-Vaccination-Rule-Compliance.pdf)(PDF) (10/8/21) [Q&A from public comment on COVID vaccination from emergency Board of EMS meeting on August 23, 2021](/ems/sites/maine.gov.ems/files/inline-files/20210823-Questions-from-Emergency-Board-Meeting.pdf)(PDF) [Chapter 20 COVID-19 Immunization Requirements](/ems/sites/maine.gov.ems/files/inline-files/Chapter-20-COVID-19-Immunization-Final-Text.pdf)(PDF) (8/27/2021) Note: This file was updated on 8/27/21 to include the effective date. [Maine EMS Public Safety Vaccination Plan](/ems/sites/maine.gov.ems/files/inline-files/20201212-Public-Safety-Vaccination-Plan.pdf)(PDF) (12/16/2020) - The Maine EMS Medical Direction & Practices Board held a series of statewide Town Hall virtual meetings to discuss the COVID vaccine for EMS clinicians. A virtual meeting was held in every region and hosted by the regional medical director, with other regional and state medical directors assisting. The goal was to provide a better understanding of the medication, to use to help guide you in your decision to receive this vaccine administration. These meetings were recorded and are available on the [Maine EMS YouTube channel](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UC7w9DU0Tv4FK-ENnQ6P9Njw). - The Maine EMS "Ready, Check and Vaccinate!" and "Maine EMS COVID-19 Vaccine Training" courses can be found by logging into licensed clinicians [MEMSEd](https://memsed.maineems.org/LMS/)account. [Maine EMS Vaccine Declination vaccine fact sheet for recipients](/ems/sites/maine.gov.ems/files/inline-files/Fact-sheet-recipients-caregivers-Moderna-COVID-19-vaccine_0.pdf)(PDF) [Moderna vaccine fact vaccine Vaccine EMS Administration Standing Order](/ems/sites/maine.gov.ems/files/inline-files/JanssenStanding%20Order.pdf)(3/9/2021) [ACOG statement on pregnancy and lactation in context of COVID vaccines](https://www.acog.org/clinical/clinical-guidance/practice-advisory/articles/2020/12/vaccinating-pregnant-and-lactating-patients-against-covid-19)(link) (12/2020) [American College of Medical Toxicology - COVID-19 and pregnancy webinar](https://www.acmt.net/Pregnancy.html)(link) (12/16/2020) [Society of Maternal and Fetal Medicine statement on COVID and pregnancy](https://s3.amazonaws.com/cdn.smfm.org/media/2641/Provider_Considerations_for_Engaging_in_COVID_Vaccination_Considerations_12-15-20_(final).pdf)(link) (12/15/2020) [What is mRNA?](/ems/sites/maine.gov.ems/files/inline-files/nrd.2017.243.pdf)(PDF) (Nature Magazine, Jan, 2018) [New England Journal of Medicine - Coronavirus Article & Resource Collection](www.nejm.org/coronavirus) [CDC Facts about Coronavirus Vaccines](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=KMc3vL_MIeo&feature=youtu.be)(YouTube video) (12/4/2020) - From JAMA - The Journal of the American Medical Association The JAMA Network is a collection of 12 international peer-reviewed medical journals that features research, reviews, and commentary across the spectrum of medical and surgical practice. Led by the flagship journal JAMA®, the JAMA Network's mission is to improve the public health by providing the information that matters most to practitioners and researchers. [COVID Presentation](https://youtu.be/ZlWKK-magw4 )(YouTube video) (12/7/2020) Atlantic Partners EMS has shared a video from a presentation on Saturday, December 5, 2020. This video is approximately 2 hours long and discusses COVID, COVID vaccines and current Maine EMS protocols surrounding COVID. This presentation is from Dr. Dora Anne Mills, the Chief Health Improvement Officer for MaineHealth and served as the Director of Public Health for the State of Maine and Director of the Maine CDC for 15 years. She is joined by Dr. Michael Bohanske, an ED physician at Maine Medical Center and Region 1 EMS Medical Director. Personnel Quarantine, Return to Work and Other Healthy Resource Documents q Visit the Maine EMS ["Stay Healthy in EMS" Resources Page](/ems/node/179) [Operational Changes to the Notification Process of EMS Clinicians Contacting Presumed Presumed or Known Positive COVID-19 Patients](/ems/sites/maine.gov.ems/files/inline-files/20201210-Operational-Bulletin-For-EMS-Clinician-Notification-of-Presumed-or-Known-Positive-COVID-19-Patient-Interactions.pdf) (PDF) (12/10/2020) [Reporting Exposed EMS Clinician and Dispatcher Information to Maine CDC](/ems/sites/maine.gov.ems/files/inline-files/2020-04-23%20Operational%20Bulletin%20Regarding%20EMS%20Personnel%20Reporting%20FINAL.pdf) (PDF) (4/23/2020) [EMS Service Spreadsheet for Documenting EMS Employee Screening](/ems/sites/maine.gov.ems/files/inline-files/2020-03-15%20Maine%20EMS%20COVID-19%20Clinician%20Screening%20Tool.xlsx) (XLS) (updated 3/15/2020) [Model EMS Employee COVID Clinician Update](/ems/sites/maine.gov.ems/files/inline-files/2020-03-15%20EMS%20Clinician%20Guidance%20on%20Ongoing%20COVID-19%20Response.pdf) (PDF) (updated 3/15/2020) [Understanding Cases, Contacts, and of Contacts](/ems/sites/maine.gov.ems/files/inline-files/20200629-Understanding-Cases-Contacts-and-Contacts-of-Contacts.pdf) (PDF) [Maine EMS Clinician Quarantine Guide](/ems/sites/maine.gov.ems/files/inline-files/20220204-Quarantine-Guidance-following-Exposure.pdf) [Return to Work Guidance](/ems/sites/maine.gov.ems/files/inline-files/20220204-Returning-to-Work-Guidance-for-Positive-COVID-19-Test-Clinicians.pdf) (PDF) (updated 2/4/2022) Equipment Resources During COVID Pandemic q PPE supply requests should be routed through local County Emergency Management Agencies (EMAs). You can find your local EMA contact information by [visiting the website here](https://www.maine.gov/mema/ema-community/county-local/county-emergency-management-agencies). - [Universal Masking Operational Bulletin](/ems/sites/maine.gov.ems/files/inline-files/20200629-Operational-Bulletin-Regarding-Universal-Masking-Update.pdf)(PDF) (updated 6/29/2020) - [Letter from Maine CDC to All EMS Agencies and Fire Services](/ems/sites/maine.gov.ems/files/inline-files/20200823-Letter-to-EMS-Agencies-and-Fire-Departments-from-ME-CDC_0.pdf)(PDF) (8/23/2020) - [Joint Position Statement on PPE Usage](/ems/sites/maine.gov.ems/files/inline-files/20200701-Joint-Statement-Regarding-PPE-Compliance-Final.pdf)(PDF) [Memo regarding PPE Inventory Surveys](/ems/sites/maine.gov.ems/files/inline-files/2020-06-16%20Memo%20Regarding%20Inventory%20Survey.pdf) the PPE Request Process](/ems/sites/maine.gov.ems/files/inline-files/2020-04-09-PPE-Resource-Request-Process.pdf) (PDF) (4/9/2020) [Use of Structural Firefighting Gear and SCBA During A COVID-19 Response](/ems/sites/maine.gov.ems/files/inline-files/2020-04-03%20SFFG%20and%20SCBA%20Clinical%20Bulletin%20Final.pdf) (PDF) (4/3/2020) [Guidance for Optimizing the Supply of Personal Protective Equipment (PPE) for EMS Clinicians](/ems/sites/maine.gov.ems/files/inline-files/Optimization-of-PPE-Supply-for-EMS-Clinicians.pdf) (3/27/2020) [Which Mask to Use?](/ems/sites/maine.gov.ems/files/inline-files/Which-Mask.pdf) (PDF) [Donning [Counterfeit KN95 Mask (PDF) Valves](/ems/sites/maine.gov.ems/files/inline-files/2020-08-21%20Operational%20Bulletin%20Regarding%20Masks%20with%20Exhalation%20Valves.pdf) (PDF) (8/21/2020) Two-Way Radio decontamination guidelines (Contact radio manufacturer if questions or not listed) Funding & Reimbursement Resources q [Public Assistance Funding Presentation by MEMA](https://youtu.be/71bIho3AQ4k)(YouTube video) (7/30/2020) [MEMA Grant Assistance Program Page](https://www.maine.gov/mema/grants/public-assistance-grant-program)(7/30/2020) - - Licensing & Training Resources Related to COVID Pandemic q 18-month Extension Maine EMS has added an 18-month extension to all current EMS provider licenses, effective May 20, 2022. [EMS Week and EMS license extension letter](/ems/sites/maine.gov.ems/files/inline-files/20220520-EMS-License-Extension-Final.pdf) (PDF) (5/20/22) [EMS PSE and Clinical checklist during COVID](/ems/sites/maine.gov.ems/files/inline-files/20200701-Approval-of-PSE-and-Clinical-Checklists.pdf) (PDF) (7/1/2020) EMS Psychomotor Testing for EMR & EMT Information is found on the [EMS Exam Resources Page](/ems/education-ceh/classes-opportunities/testing) Certification Policies and Guidelines from other organizations [American Heart to the NREMT info](https://www.nremt.org/rwd/public/document/covid-19#distributive-education-update) State/Federal COVID-19 Resource Links q
